footer.copy: © {{year}} ROJEK windows & doors. All rights reserved.

windows.name: WOODEN WINDOWS
windows.description: Wooden windows are a classic solution combining natural materials, excellent insulation and an elegant look that gives interiors a distinctive character.
benefits: Highest quality natural wood
Environmentally friendly and healthy for residents
Unique design and aesthetics
Rich palette of colors and finishes
Very long lifespan and structural durability
Excellent thermal and acoustic insulation parameters

woodAlu.name: WOOD–ALUMINIUM WINDOWS
woodAlu.description: Wood–aluminium windows combine the warmth of natural wood on the interior with durable, weather‑resistant aluminium cladding on the exterior.
benefits: Wood interior combined with aluminium exterior
High durability with low maintenance requirements
Excellent thermal and acoustic insulation
Wide range of external finishes and colours
Suitable for both modern and classic designs
UV and weather resistant aluminium protection

exteriorDoors.name: EXTERIOR DOORS
exteriorDoors.description: Exterior doors are the business card of the house. Our doors combine uncompromising security, refined aesthetics and excellent thermal insulation.
benefits: Solid construction guaranteeing security
High thermal and acoustic insulation
Resistance to weather conditions and warping
Wide selection of patterns, from classic to modern
Possibility of using modern access control systems
Individual adjustment of dimensions and accessories

fireDoors.name: FIRE DOORS
fireDoors.description: Fire doors are designed to provide fire resistance and protection where required by safety regulations, combining certified performance with robust construction.
benefits: Certified fire resistance classes
Improved fire safety for the building
Robust, fire‑resistant construction
Options for anti‑burglary enhancements
Maintains insulation performance under stress
Customisable to project and regulation requirements

interiorDoors.name: INTERIOR DOORS
interiorDoors.description: Interior doors are an interior element that combines functionality with elegance. Our interior doors perfectly complement any arrangement style.
benefits: Elegant design harmonizing with interior decor
Wide possibilities for personalizing patterns and colors
Excellent acoustic insulation between rooms
Durable construction from high-quality materials
Precise workmanship ensuring smooth operation
Rich selection of hardware and functional accessories

sliding.name: SLIDING WINDOWS (HS)
sliding.description: HS sliding systems are a modern solution that allows creating impressive glazing and a smooth connection between interior and terrace or garden.
benefits: Maximum interior lighting thanks to large glass surfaces
Space saving compared to traditional balcony doors
Easy and comfortable operation even of very large sashes
Modern design and possibility of creating panoramic views
High tightness and excellent thermal insulation parameters
Possible in low‑threshold variants for enhanced comfort

psk.name: PSK
psk.description: The PSK system is a practical tilt‑and‑slide solution combining ventilation (tilt) with comfortable sliding operation for large glazed elements.
benefits: Tilt and slide function in one system
Comfortable operation and safe ventilation
Good thermal performance while maintaining convenience
Suitable for large sash sizes
Aesthetically finished and adaptable to façades
Low‑threshold options available for improved access

windows.featuresTitle: What makes the {{product}} window stand out?

warranty.title: Quality you can rely on for years
warranty.text: We are confident in the quality of our products, which is why within 5 years after installation you can report any issue with any part of our window joinery. In addition, we offer a 10‑year warranty for the tightness of glazing units with a Warmatec spacer.

cta.title: Interested in {{product}} windows?
cta.description: Our experts will help you choose the perfect solution for your home. Contact us to get a free quote.

doors.featuresTitle: What makes the {{product}} door stand out?

warranty.title: Quality you can rely on for years
warranty.text: We are confident in the quality of our products, which is why within 5 years after installation you can report any issue with any part of our joinery. In addition, we offer a 10‑year warranty for the tightness of glazing units with a Warmatec spacer.

cta.title: Interested in {{product}} doors?
cta.description: Our experts will help you choose the perfect solution for your home. Contact us to get a free quote.

lock.title: 3‑point lock as standard
lock.description: Security starts with reliable locking. A standard 3‑point lock secures the door leaf in several places at once, improving resistance to forced entry and enhancing gasket pressure.

threshold.title: Low aluminium threshold
threshold.description: A low threshold improves everyday comfort – it makes passage easier, increases accessibility and supports water drainage. It’s a small detail that makes a big difference.

faq.title: <product>{{product}}</product> – Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most important questions about our product

errors.productNotFoundText: The selected product does not exist.

A.title: 2-part (1 fixed sash + 1 sliding sash)
A.description: The simplest and most frequently chosen configuration. One sash is fixed (non-opening), while the other slides parallel to it.
A.usage: Access to a terrace, balcony, or garden in standard widths.

A3.title: 2-part (1 fixed sash + 1 sliding sash – mirrored version)
A3.description: A layout equivalent to scheme A, with sliding in the opposite direction. It allows matching the opening side to the room layout.
A3.usage: When left-side opening is required or alignment with a wall, built-in furniture, or circulation path is needed.

C.title: 4-part (2 sliding sashes + 2 fixed)
C.description: Two sliding sashes enable a wide opening of the space. Fixed elements stabilize the structure and provide a large glazed area.
C.usage: Large terrace glazing in modern homes, wide openings to the garden.

D.title: 2-part (2 sliding sashes)
D.description: Both sashes are movable and can slide in opposite directions. This enables flexible opening depending on user needs.
D.usage: Terraces and gardens where symmetry and two-way opening functionality are required.

E.title: 3-part (2 sliding sashes + 1 fixed)
E.description: A solution combining a wide passage opening with a large fixed glazed area. Two sliding sashes provide convenient operation.
E.usage: Modern living rooms with large glazing and panoramic views.

F.title: 4-part (4 sliding sashes)
F.description: All sashes are movable and can slide both left and right. A symmetrical layout enabling a very wide opening of the entire construction and maximum flexibility of use.
F.usage: Large, representative terrace glazing in modern homes and residences where panoramic opening and a glass-wall effect are key.

G2.title: 3-part asymmetric with static mullion (1 sliding sash + 2 fixed)
G2.description: An asymmetric layout with a visible structural mullion. One sliding sash provides comfortable access, while the remaining elements are fixed.
G2.usage: Wide glazing with maintained structural stability.

G3.title: 3-part asymmetric without static mullion (1 sliding sash + 2 fixed)
G3.description: A modern variant without a visible center mullion. It delivers a more uniform glass surface and a cleaner visual effect.
G3.usage: Minimalist architectural projects where maximum aesthetics and view are essential.

H.title: 3-part (3 sliding sashes)
H.description: All sashes are movable, allowing flexible and wide opening of the space in both directions.
H.usage: Large terrace glazing in premium homes and modern residences.

K.title: 3-part (2 sliding sashes + 1 fixed – central layout)
K.description: The fixed element is located in the center, while sliding sashes operate on both sides. A solution with high aesthetics and a symmetrical appearance.
K.usage: Wide facades with a representative exit to the terrace or garden.

realizations.subtitle: See our realizations
realizations.description: Below we present selected projects that we have implemented for our clients. Each order is a new challenge for us, which we face with passion and professionalism.

tradition.description: Since 1981, we have been creating the highest quality carpentry, combining years of experience with modern technologies.

individual.title: Individual approach
individual.description: We treat each order exceptionally, adapting solutions to the needs and expectations of our clients.

ecological.description: We use only certified, environmentally friendly materials of the highest quality.

precision.description: Attention to the smallest details and perfect finishing is our hallmark.

warranty.description: We provide multi-year warranty and professional service for our products.

delivery.description: We meet agreed deadlines, respecting our clients' time.

company.title: About our company
company.subtitle: Get to know us from the inside
company.description: ROJEK is a family company with many years of experience in the production of windows and doors. We specialize in wooden and wood-aluminum solutions of the highest quality.

history.title: Our History
history.subtitle: Over 40 years of experience in the industry
history.intro1: ROJEK is a family business with over 40 years of tradition. From the very beginning, we focus on the highest quality, individual approach to customers and continuous development.
history.intro2: Our history is a story of passion, determination and constant pursuit of excellence. Each stage of our development was thoughtful and aimed at delivering products that meet the highest standards.

item1.title: Historic restorations
item1.text: Under my leadership we completed hundreds of prestigious restorations of historic buildings in Kraków and across Poland and Europe.

item2.title: New production line
item2.text: We launched a modern production line for single-frame wooden windows. This allowed us to manufacture thousands of square meters of windows for developers, housing estates and private clients.

item3.title: PRZ Stolarnia
item3.text: As a result of restructuring, PRZ Stolarnia was formed as an independent company where I continue the business together with my sons.

item4.title: Sliding windows
item4.text: We introduced HS and PSK sliding windows to our production, equipped with innovative G-U hardware solutions and thermal composite thresholds.

item5.title: Wood–aluminium windows
item5.text: We started production of wood–aluminium windows — the beauty of wood inside combined with durable protection outside. These solutions have been increasingly appreciated by both domestic and international clients.

item6.title: Historical projects
item6.text: Together with our partners from France we developed and implemented a window model based on traditional historical patterns using Cremona-style casement fittings. The product is intended for historic buildings; we currently have several realizations in Paris, including in the Versailles area.

item7.title: Model for the Belgian market
item7.text: We supplemented our offer with a modified window model featuring a wooden drip rail, designed for the Belgian market.

history.ctaText: Contact us and learn more about our products and services

headquarters.title: Company headquarters
headquarters.subtitle: Our location
headquarters.description1: The production facility is located in Kryspinów 399, near the A4 highway.
headquarters.description2: We invite you to visit our showroom, where you can see the full range of our products and receive expert advice.

gdpr.notice: The controller of your personal data is ROJEK Okna i Drzwi Sp. z o.o. with its registered office in Kraków (Kryspinów 399, 32-060 Kryspinów). Personal data will be processed in order to respond to your inquiry and to ensure the highest service standards. Submitting the form constitutes voluntary consent to be contacted by email or phone for the purpose of handling the inquiry. Consent may be withdrawn at any time by sending a message to biuro@rojekoid.pl.

tooltips.profileThickness: Profile thickness (e.g. 70–86 mm) affects structural rigidity and allows using thicker glazing units.
tooltips.thermalTransmittance: Thermal transmittance (Uw) indicates how much heat escapes through the window. The lower the value, the better the insulation and the lower the heating costs.
tooltips.waterTightness: Water tightness (e.g. class 9A) indicates resistance to water penetration during rain and wind. A higher class means better protection against leakage.
tooltips.lockSystem: A multi‑point lock provides significantly higher security than a standard lock. It locks the door in several places at once, making forced entry more difficult.
tooltips.threshold: A low aluminium threshold improves accessibility, is easy to keep clean and helps drain water, protecting the entrance from flooding.
